name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: Crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.
eligibility: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers growing notified crops
benefits: Insurance coverage and financial support for crop loss. Premium: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, 5% for commercial crops.

name: PM-KISAN (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi)
description: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year to all landholding farmer families, paid in three equal installments.
eligibility: All landholding farmer families with cultivable land
benefits: ₹6,000 per year in 3 installments of ₹2,000 each directly to bank account

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Government provides soil health cards to farmers with crop-wise nutrient recommendations for improving soil health and productivity.
eligibility: All farmers across India
benefits: Free soil testing and nutrient-based recommendations for better crop yield

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
description: Scheme to expand cultivable area under assured irrigation, improve water use efficiency, and promote precision irrigation.
eligibility: All farmers, priority to small and marginal farmers
benefits: Subsidy on micro-irrigation (drip/sprinkler): 55% for small farmers, 45% for others

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
description: Provides affordable credit to farmers for crop production, post-harvest expenses, and allied agricultural activities.
eligibility: All farmers, fishermen, and animal husbandry farmers
benefits: Credit up to ₹3 lakh at 4% interest rate (with subvention). Crop insurance included.

name: National Mission on Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
description: Promotes sustainable agriculture through climate change adaptation measures, water use efficiency, and soil health management.
eligibility: All farmers, focus on rainfed areas
benefits: Financial support for organic farming, soil health management, and water harvesting structures

name: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market)
description: Online trading platform for agricultural commodities, enabling transparent price discovery and better price realization for farmers.
eligibility: All farmers who want to sell produce through electronic market
benefits: Transparent bidding, better prices, reduced middlemen, direct payment to bank

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
description: Promotes organic farming through adoption of organic village clusters with PGS certification.
eligibility: Group of 50+ farmers with 50 acres contiguous land
benefits: ₹50,000 per hectare for 3 years. Includes organic inputs, certification, branding.

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY-RAFTAAR)
description: Incentivizes states to increase public investment in agriculture, supports agri-startups, and promotes innovation in agriculture.
eligibility: Implemented through state governments for all farmers
benefits: Funding for infrastructure, technology adoption, agri-enterprise development. Up to ₹25 lakh for agri-startups.

name: PM Kisan Maan Dhan Yojana
description: Pension scheme for small and marginal farmers providing ₹3,000/month pension after age 60.
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers aged 18-40 years with land up to 2 hectares
benefits: ₹3,000/month pension after 60. Monthly contribution ₹55-200 based on entry age.

name: Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization (SMAM)
description: Promotes farm mechanization to increase productivity and reduce drudgery, with subsidies on farm equipment.
eligibility: All farmers, higher subsidy for SC/ST/small/marginal farmers
benefits: Subsidy 40-50% on purchase of farm machinery. Custom hiring centers establishment support.

name: National Horticulture Mission (NHM)
description: Promotes holistic growth of horticulture sector including fruits, vegetables, spices, and plantation crops.
eligibility: All farmers growing horticultural crops
benefits: Subsidy for planting material, drip irrigation, protected cultivation, post-harvest management
applicable_crops: Fruits, Vegetables, Spices, Flowers, Plantation crops

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Financing facility for investment in post-harvest management and community farming assets. ₹1 lakh crore fund.
eligibility: Farmers, FPOs, PACS, agri-entrepreneurs, startups
benefits: 3% interest subvention on loans up to ₹2 crore. Credit guarantee up to ₹2 crore under CGTMSE.

name: Interest Subvention Scheme (ISS)
description: Provides short-term crop loans to farmers at subsidized interest of 4% per annum (with prompt repayment).
eligibility: All farmers availing crop loans up to ₹3 lakh
benefits: 2% interest subvention by GOI + 3% prompt repayment incentive = effective rate 4%

name: Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan (PM-AASHA)
description: Umbrella scheme ensuring MSP to farmers with Price Support Scheme (PSS), Price Deficiency Payment (PDPS), and Private Procurement.
eligibility: All farmers growing crops covered under MSP
benefits: Government purchases at MSP when market price falls below. Direct price deficiency payment to farmers.

name: Neem Coated Urea Scheme
description: Mandatory neem coating of urea to prevent diversion, improve nitrogen use efficiency, and reduce input costs.
eligibility: All urea-using farmers across India
benefits: Better nitrogen efficiency (10-15% more yield), reduced requirement, lower pest incidence

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)
description: Scheme for sustainable development of fisheries sector with ₹20,050 crore investment for 5 years.
eligibility: Fishermen, fish farmers, fish workers, fish vendors, SHGs, FPOs in fisheries
benefits: 40-60% subsidy for fisheries infrastructure. Insurance for fishermen. Cold chain and market support.

name: National Livestock Mission (NLM)
description: Promotes sustainable livestock development including breed improvement, feed/fodder development, and entrepreneurship.
eligibility: All livestock farmers, entrepreneurs in animal husbandry
benefits: Subsidy up to 50% for poultry, sheep, goat farming. ₹25 lakh support for entrepreneurship.
ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying

name: Dairy Entrepreneurship Development Scheme (DEDS)
description: Promotes setting up modern dairy farms for milk production, procurement, and processing.
eligibility: Farmers, individual entrepreneurs, NGOs, SHGs
benefits: 25-33% capital subsidy. Up to ₹7 lakh for dairy units of 10 animals. ₹18 lakh for processing units.
ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying

name: National Bee-keeping & Honey Mission (NBHM)
description: Promotes scientific beekeeping to increase crop productivity through pollination and generate additional income for farmers.
eligibility: All farmers, beekeepers, FPOs, entrepreneurs
benefits: Subsidy on bee colonies, equipment, processing units. Training and capacity building support.

name: Operation Greens (TOP to TOTAL)
description: Price stabilization of Tomato, Onion, Potato expanded to all fruits & vegetables. 50% subsidy on transport & storage.
eligibility: FPOs, food processors, cooperatives, individual farmers
benefits: 50% subsidy on transportation from surplus to deficient markets. 50% on storage infrastructure.

name: Gramin Bhandaran Yojana (Rural Godown Scheme)
description: Subsidy for construction/renovation of rural godowns to prevent post-harvest losses and enable better price realization.
eligibility: Individuals, farmers, FPOs, cooperatives, SHGs, companies
benefits: 25% subsidy (33.33% for SC/ST/NE). Capacity 100-30,000 tonnes. NABARD refinance available.

name: Micro Irrigation Fund (MIF)
description: ₹5,000 crore dedicated fund with NABARD for promoting micro irrigation (drip & sprinkler) systems.
eligibility: State governments and farmers through state schemes
benefits: Low-interest loans to states. Farmers get 55-70% subsidy on drip/sprinkler systems.

name: National Project on Organic Farming (NPOF)
description: Promotes organic farming through capacity building, input production, quality control, and market development.
eligibility: All farmers transitioning to organic farming
benefits: Free training, subsidized organic inputs, certification support, marketing assistance

name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
description: Increases production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, and commercial crops through area expansion and productivity enhancement.
eligibility: All farmers in identified districts
benefits: Subsidized seeds, INM/IPM demos, farm machinery, sprinkler sets. 50% subsidy on most components.
applicable_crops: Rice, Wheat, Pulses, Coarse Cereals, Cotton, Jute, Sugarcane

name: Pradhan Mantri Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PMFME)
description: Supports upgradation of micro food processing enterprises with credit-linked subsidy and capacity building.
eligibility: Existing micro food processing units, FPOs, SHGs, cooperatives
benefits: 35% credit-linked capital subsidy (max ₹10 lakh). Seed capital ₹40,000 per SHG member. Branding and marketing support.

name: National Bamboo Mission (NBM)
description: Promotes bamboo plantation, post-harvest processing, product development, and marketing to supplement farmer income.
eligibility: All farmers, artisans, entrepreneurs in bamboo sector
benefits: Subsidy for bamboo plantation, nurseries, processing units. ₹120/plant for bamboo cultivation.

name: Vivad Se Vishwas (Farm Loan Settlement)
description: One-time settlement scheme for stressed farm loans enabling farmers to start fresh with clean credit history.
eligibility: Farmers with overdue crop loans in banks
benefits: Waiver of interest and penalties, reduced settlement amount, fresh credit eligibility restored

name: Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran Pariyojana (MKSP)
description: Sub-component of NRLM to empower women in agriculture with improved farming skills, nutrition, and livelihoods.
eligibility: Women farmers, especially from poor and marginalized households
benefits: Training in sustainable agriculture, nutrition gardens, seed banks. ₹3 lakh per SHG for agri-livelihoods.

name: Venture Capital Assistance Scheme for SC/ST
description: SFAC venture capital assistance to agribusiness projects promoted by SC/ST entrepreneurs.
eligibility: SC/ST entrepreneurs in agribusiness with viable project proposals
benefits: Up to 26% of project cost as equity contribution (max ₹50 lakh). No interest or repayment obligation.

name: National Mission on Edible Oils (NMEO-Oil Palm)
description: Promotes domestic oilseed and oil palm cultivation to reduce import dependency with ₹11,040 crore outlay.
eligibility: All farmers in identified oil palm growing regions
benefits: ₹29,000/ha for oil palm planting. MSP structure for Fresh Fruit Bunches. Input support for oilseeds.
applicable_states: Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Gujarat, Odisha
applicable_crops: Oil Palm, Soybean, Mustard, Groundnut, Sunflower

name: Per Drop More Crop (PDMC)
description: Component of PMKSY focused on enhancing water use efficiency through micro irrigation and better water management.
eligibility: All farmers, priority to water-stressed regions
benefits: 55% subsidy for small/marginal farmers, 45% for others on drip and sprinkler irrigation systems.

name: Formation and Promotion of FPOs Scheme
description: Central scheme to form and promote 10,000 new Farmer Producer Organizations with handholding support for 5 years.
eligibility: Groups of farmers (min 300 in plains, 100 in NE/hilly areas) forming FPOs
benefits: ₹18 lakh per FPO for formation/incubation. Up to ₹15 lakh equity grant. ₹2 crore credit guarantee.

name: Integrated Scheme for Agricultural Marketing (ISAM)
description: Supports development of agricultural marketing infrastructure including grading, standardization, and quality certification.
eligibility: State governments, marketing boards, cooperatives, private sector
benefits: 33-40% subsidy for marketing infrastructure. Support for grading labs, pack houses, cold storage.

name: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH)
description: Comprehensive scheme for holistic growth of horticulture covering fruits, vegetables, spices, medicinal plants, and flowers.
eligibility: All horticulture farmers, nurseries, and agribusinesses
benefits: 40-75% subsidy for area expansion, protected cultivation (polyhouse/shade net), PHM infrastructure.
applicable_crops: Fruits, Vegetables, Spices, Medicinal Plants, Flowers, Plantation Crops

name: National Agriculture Market (NAM) Integration
description: Grants to APMCs/mandis for upgrading infrastructure and integrating with the e-NAM electronic trading platform.
eligibility: APMCs willing to undertake reforms and integrate with e-NAM
benefits: ₹75 lakh per mandi for IT infrastructure, quality testing labs, and grading equipment.

name: Modified Interest Subvention Scheme (MISS)
description: Provides 1.5% interest subvention to banks for providing crop loans to farmers up to ₹3 lakh at 7% interest.
eligibility: All farmers availing short-term crop loans from banks/cooperatives/RRBs
benefits: Effective interest rate of 4% for prompt repayment. Natural calamity relief with 2% interest.

name: Digital Agriculture Mission
description: India's programme to build digital infrastructure for agriculture using AI, Remote Sensing, GIS, and Drones for farmers.
eligibility: All farmers — benefits delivered via AgriStack and Farmer ID
benefits: Unique Farmer ID, digital crop survey, soil/weather advisories via mobile, drone-based crop monitoring.

name: Drone Kisan Yojana (Kisan Drone Subsidy)
description: Subsidies for purchase of agricultural drones for crop monitoring, precision spraying, and land mapping.
eligibility: FPOs, CHCs, agricultural graduates, SC/ST/women entrepreneurs
benefits: Up to 50% or ₹5 lakh subsidy on drone purchase for SC/ST, women, NE farmers. 40% for others.

name: National Oilseed and Oil Palm Mission
description: Boosts production of oilseeds (mustard, groundnut, soybean, sunflower) and oil palm to reduce edible oil imports.
eligibility: All farmers in oilseed growing regions
benefits: Subsidized seeds, INM inputs, oil palm planting material support, cluster demonstrations.
applicable_crops: Mustard, Groundnut, Soybean, Sunflower, Oil Palm

name: Maharashtra — Namo Shetkari Maha Sanman Nidhi
description: State top-up of ₹6,000/year to PM-KISAN beneficiaries, making total income support ₹12,000/year for Maharashtra farmers.
eligibility: All PM-KISAN beneficiary farmers in Maharashtra
benefits: ₹6,000 per year in 3 installments of ₹2,000 each, additional to PM-KISAN

name: Maharashtra — Magel Tyala Shettale (Farm Pond Scheme)
description: Provides 100% subsidy for farm pond construction to SC/ST farmers and 50% for others in drought-prone Maharashtra.
eligibility: All farmers in Maharashtra, priority to drought-prone areas
benefits: 100% subsidy for SC/ST farmers. 50% for others (max ₹75,000). Water harvesting and storage.

name: Maharashtra — Chief Minister Solar Agriculture Pump Scheme
description: Provides 95% subsidy for solar-powered agricultural water pumps to farmers in Maharashtra.
eligibility: Maharashtra farmers with agricultural land and water source
benefits: 95% subsidy on 3HP/5HP/7.5HP solar pumps. Farmer pays only 5% contribution.

name: Maharashtra — Birsa Munda Krishi Kranti Yojana
description: Special agricultural scheme for tribal farmers in Maharashtra with support for wells, farm mechanization, and inputs.
eligibility: Tribal (ST) farmers in Maharashtra
benefits: ₹4 lakh for new well. 90% subsidy on farm equipment. Free quality seeds and inputs.

name: Punjab — Punjab Kisan Credit Card Scheme
description: State-enhanced KCC with 0% interest on crop loans up to ₹1 lakh for Punjab farmers.
eligibility: All farmers in Punjab with valid KCC
benefits: 0% interest on crop loans up to ₹1 lakh. 2% for ₹1-3 lakh. State bears the interest subvention.

name: Punjab — Pani Bachao Paisa Kamao (Save Water Earn Money)
description: Incentivizes farmers to reduce paddy transplanting time and save groundwater with direct cash payments.
eligibility: Punjab farmers who delay paddy transplanting by 7+ days
benefits: ₹1,000/acre/day incentive for delayed transplanting. Promotes direct seeded rice. Groundwater conservation.

name: Haryana — Meri Fasal Mera Byora
description: Online crop registration portal ensuring farmers get MSP procurement and access to government schemes in Haryana.
eligibility: All farmers in Haryana who register their crops online
benefits: Guaranteed MSP procurement. Access to insurance, subsidies, and advisories through one portal.
applicable_crops: Wheat, Rice, Mustard, Cotton, Sugarcane, Maize

name: Haryana — Bhavantar Bharpai Yojana
description: Price deficiency payment scheme for vegetables — government pays difference between market price and protected price.
eligibility: Haryana farmers growing notified vegetables and registered on Meri Fasal Mera Byora
benefits: Direct payment of price difference to bank account. Covers tomato, onion, potato, cauliflower, etc.
applicable_crops: Tomato, Onion, Potato, Cauliflower, Carrot, Peas, Mushroom

name: Uttar Pradesh — Kisan Kalyan Mission
description: Comprehensive mission to double farmer income in UP with 6 components including organic farming and livestock development.
eligibility: All farmers in Uttar Pradesh
benefits: Free seeds, soil testing, solar pump subsidy, animal health camps, organic farming training.

name: Uttar Pradesh — Mukhyamantri Krishak Durghatna Kalyan Yojana
description: Accident insurance for UP farmers — ₹5 lakh for death, ₹2 lakh for permanent disability from farming accidents.
eligibility: All registered farmers aged 18-70 in Uttar Pradesh
benefits: ₹5 lakh compensation for death. ₹2 lakh for permanent disability. ₹1 lakh for partial disability.

name: Madhya Pradesh — Mukhyamantri Kisan Kalyan Yojana
description: State top-up of ₹4,000/year to PM-KISAN beneficiaries, making total ₹10,000/year for MP farmers.
eligibility: All PM-KISAN beneficiary farmers in Madhya Pradesh
benefits: ₹4,000 per year in 2 installments of ₹2,000. Additional to PM-KISAN ₹6,000.

name: Madhya Pradesh — e-Uparjan (MSP Procurement)
description: Online MSP procurement portal where MP farmers register and sell crops at minimum support price directly to government.
eligibility: All farmers in Madhya Pradesh with registered land
benefits: Guaranteed MSP procurement for wheat, rice, gram, soybean, mustard. Direct payment via DBT.
applicable_crops: Wheat, Rice, Chickpea, Soybean, Mustard, Maize
ministry: Dept. of Food & Civil Supplies, Madhya Pradesh

name: Rajasthan — Mukhyamantri Krishak Sathi Yojana
description: Financial assistance to Rajasthan farmers and agricultural labourers in case of accidents during farming activities.
eligibility: All farmers and agricultural workers in Rajasthan aged 5-70 years
benefits: ₹2 lakh for death, ₹50,000 for finger loss, ₹25,000-50,000 for fractures. Free treatment.

name: Rajasthan — Tanka/Nadi/Talab Construction Scheme
description: Water harvesting scheme for arid Rajasthan — subsidized construction of water storage structures for irrigation.
eligibility: All farmers in arid/semi-arid districts of Rajasthan
benefits: 70-90% subsidy on water harvesting structures. ₹1.4 lakh for farm tanka. ₹3 lakh for farm pond.

name: Karnataka — Raitha Siri (Farmer Support)
description: Direct income support to small and marginal farmers in Karnataka not covered under PM-KISAN.
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers (<5 acres) in Karnataka
benefits: ₹10,000 per year income support. Seeds, fertilizers subsidy. Priority in state schemes.

name: Karnataka — Krishi Bhagya Scheme
description: Integrated water management for rainfed farming in Karnataka with farm ponds, polyhouse, and drip irrigation.
eligibility: Farmers with rainfed land in identified Karnataka districts
benefits: 90% subsidy for farm pond (30x30x3m). Polyhouse support. Drip irrigation. Shade net installation.

name: Tamil Nadu — Uzhavar Pathukappu Thittam (Farmer Protection)
description: Comprehensive farmer protection scheme in Tamil Nadu covering crop insurance, input subsidy, and disaster relief.
eligibility: All farmers registered in Tamil Nadu
benefits: Crop insurance premium subsidy. ₹20,000/ha drought relief. Free seed distribution for affected areas.

name: Tamil Nadu — Free Electricity for Agriculture
description: Free electricity for agricultural pump sets in Tamil Nadu, saving thousands per farmer per year.
eligibility: All farmers with agricultural pump connections in Tamil Nadu
benefits: 100% free electricity for agricultural pumpsets up to 10HP. No power bills.

name: Gujarat — Kisan Parivahan Yojana
description: Subsidy on purchase of transport vehicles for farmers to carry agricultural produce to mandis and markets.
eligibility: Gujarat farmers with valid farmer certificate
benefits: Up to ₹75,000 subsidy on 3-wheeler transport. ₹1.25 lakh on small commercial vehicles.

name: Gujarat — Mukhyamantri Kisan Sahay Yojana
description: Gujarat's own crop insurance scheme providing compensation for crop loss due to drought, excess rain, or unseasonal rain.
eligibility: All farmers in Gujarat growing Kharif crops (no premium required)
benefits: ₹20,000/ha for 33-60% crop loss. ₹25,000/ha for >60% loss. No premium — fully state-funded.

name: West Bengal — Krishak Bandhu (Farmers' Friend)
description: Income support scheme giving ₹10,000/year directly to West Bengal farmers in two installments.
eligibility: All farmers in West Bengal with cultivable land
benefits: ₹10,000/year (₹5,000 in Kharif + ₹5,000 in Rabi). Death benefit of ₹2 lakh for registered farmers.

name: Andhra Pradesh — YSR Rythu Bharosa (Farmer Assurance)
description: AP investment support scheme providing ₹13,500/year to farmers in 3 installments, covering input costs each season.
eligibility: All farmers in Andhra Pradesh with cultivable land (including landless through RBK)
benefits: ₹13,500/year (₹7,500 Kharif + ₹4,000 Rabi + ₹2,000 bonus). Investment support before sowing.

name: Andhra Pradesh — YSR Free Crop Insurance
description: AP pays 100% crop insurance premium on behalf of farmers — farmers get PMFBY benefits with zero premium.
eligibility: All farmers in AP who register for PMFBY
benefits: Zero premium for farmer. Full PMFBY coverage. State pays all premium share.

name: Telangana — Rythu Bandhu (Farmer Investment Support)
description: Oldest state investment support scheme — ₹10,000/acre/year to all Telangana farmers for input purchase.
eligibility: All land-owning farmers in Telangana (including owner cultivators)
benefits: ₹10,000 per acre per year in 2 installments (₹5,000 each for Kharif and Rabi). No upper limit on acres.

name: Telangana — Rythu Bima (Farmer Insurance)
description: Free life insurance of ₹5 lakh for all Telangana farmers aged 18-59, fully funded by state government.
eligibility: All registered farmers in Telangana aged 18-59 years
benefits: ₹5 lakh life insurance (death benefit). Zero premium for farmer. Coverage through LIC.

name: Odisha — KALIA (Krushak Assistance for Livelihood)
description: Comprehensive livelihood support for Odisha farmers and landless labourers with financial assistance and insurance.
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers, landless agricultural households, sharecroppers in Odisha
benefits: ₹12,500/year for cultivators. ₹12,500/year for landless households. ₹2 lakh life insurance. ₹2 lakh accident insurance.

name: Bihar — Bihar Rajya Fasal Sahayata Yojana
description: Bihar's crop damage assistance scheme, providing per-hectare compensation without any premium requirement.
eligibility: All farmers in Bihar who register and suffer crop damage ≥20%
benefits: ₹7,500/ha for 20%+ damage. ₹10,000/ha for threshold damage. No premium required.
applicable_crops: Rice, Wheat, Maize, Chickpea, Lentil, Mustard, Onion

name: Bihar — Diesel/Electricity Subsidy for Irrigation
description: Subsidized diesel and electricity for agricultural irrigation in Bihar to reduce farming costs.
eligibility: All farmers in Bihar using diesel/electric pumps for irrigation
benefits: ₹75/litre diesel subsidy for irrigation. 60 paise/unit electricity subsidy. Direct bank transfer.

name: Kerala — Kisan Bima Yojana (State Crop Insurance)
description: Kerala state-funded comprehensive crop insurance for paddy, banana, pepper, coconut, and other plantation crops.
eligibility: All Kerala farmers growing notified crops
benefits: Subsidized premiums (50% state share). Coverage for flood, drought, pest damage. Quick settlement.
applicable_crops: Rice, Banana, Pepper, Coconut, Rubber, Cashew

name: Kerala — Subhiksha Keralam (Prosperous Kerala)
description: Food security scheme to increase food crop production in Kerala by converting fallow land and promoting collective farming.
eligibility: Farmer groups, Kudumbashree units, youth groups in Kerala
benefits: Free seeds, saplings, fertilizers. ₹15,000/ha cultivation support. Marketing linkages.
